result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexxa N Vassar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances  without a valid prescription, or drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No violent contact with Victims or Witnesses.

Attend Anger Management.  No dangerous weapons (Knives, firearms, etc)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexxa N Vassar

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Andy Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 10:00 a.m.
Intern Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Alexxa N Vassar.  
Defendant Alexxa N Vassar in court.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense requests expunction.  State has no position.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
60-Days Jail
Sentence is to run Consecutive to 22CM0754.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  12 Months
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Violent contact with: victims or witnesses
Anger Management
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243.00
Domestic Abuse Surcharge:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
